title: Re: EGA
content:
That's a good picture, but I have to admit I'm not such a great fan of that style of rendering. I always found that using colours that are unrelated (like brown and light magenta as different shades of the same "colour") always give the picture an odd sort of a look. I think it's because that's the style a lot of games used before they figured out how to use the EGA palette properly. I don't think you'll find that style in many of Apogee's games (other than some of the story scenes, which are made to look somewhat more realistic.)

At any rate I don't mean to criticise your work, it's a great picture!

[quote]Quote:[hr]I think it's because that's the style a lot of games used before they figured out how to use the EGA palette properly.[hr][/quote]

Is there even a proper way of doing that?
There may be as many ways as there are people using the palette, but I don't think there really is a right way.

Basically it's art, and you can like some art, dislike other, but you can't say for instance Van Gogh didn't paint properly because he makes all those little stripy thingies instead of "properly" using his brush.

Of course I could make terribly ugly 16 colour art, no problem, and if I spent some time on it, I'm sure I could draw something nice as well, and I know what you mean (probably), but I still felt like posting the above. title: Re: wow
content:
Well for example in allstories' picture I don't immediately see the purple/red shirt as different shades of a colour, I see it as Keen wearing a purple shirt with a bright red light shining in from his left - which then makes me wonder why that red light isn't shining on the Yorp or Lindsay as well.

What I meant by not using the EGA palette properly was that a lot of early commercial games seemed to use hand drawn/true colour graphics, that were then reduced to 16 colours. That reduction algorithm rarely did a good job, and although allstories' picture uses the colours quite well certain elements (like the purple/red shirt) just remind me of that horrible 16-colour scanned image look [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Of course from a purely technical point of view, the blending between the purple and the red (and the rest of the image) is superb! This is, as others have pointed out, just a personal preference for art style...
